feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 06 at 9:19PM AKST until February 07 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously wind chills to 65 below, and blowing snow with reduced visibility occuring. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Southeastern Brooks Range Passes.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 06 at 9:19PM AKST until February 07 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST MONDAY|... * WHAT...Snow occurring. Plan on slippery road conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. Storm total snow accumulations of 6 to 8 inches expected. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range south of Black Rapids. * WHEN...Until 9 PM Monday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 06 at 9:19PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations around one inch are expected. * WHERE...Dalton Highway Summits.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Plan on slippery road conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. Additional snow accumulations around one 1 inch are expected.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 06 at 9:05PM AKST until February 07 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 40 below zero to 55 below zero. * WHERE...Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 06 at 2:56PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: An atmospheric river will move over the Gulf of Alaska and into the panhandle for the late Tuesday to Thursday time period. This will bring a period of moderate to heavy rain as the moisture band moves over panhandle. A couple of waves will move along the main moisture band and produce impulses of heavier precipitation. Precise timing and location of the heaviest precipitation over

entry.summary: ...Slippery Conditions Possible Early this Morning... Light freezing drizzle mixed with snow will move across far northeast Illinois through 5 AM CST. entry.title: Flood Warning issued February 06 at 9:49PM CST until February 13 at 1:20AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Kentucky... Illinois...Indiana... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, and Shawneetown. .Recent precipitation has caused the Ohio River to rise. The river is forecast to reach flood stage at multiple locations early this week, and will remain above flood stage for the rest of the week.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 07 at 4:35AM EST by NWS

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...A period of light freezing rain is expected. Total ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Mecklenburg County. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST this morning.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued February 07 at 4:03AM AST until February 08 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents due to breaking waves of 7 to 11 feet. * WHERE...All the north local beaches at St. thomas and St. John. * WHEN...Through Tuesday afternoon.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued February 07 at 4:03AM AST until February 08 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet. * WHERE...Northern and eastern beaches of Saint Croix. * WHEN...Through Tuesday afternoon.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 07 at 4:32AM EST until February 08 at 7:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of a dusting to two inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Southern Vermont. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 7 AM EST Tuesday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 07 at 3:42AM EST until February 08 at 1:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Orange, Windsor and Eastern Rutland Counties. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 1 AM EST Tuesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 07 at 2:57AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong to High Wind Late this Afternoon into Tonight... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...West wind 25 to 35 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph. Occasional gusts between 55 and 70 mph are possible west of Clark and near Chief Joseph.
